metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11745 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When encrypting with a block cipher, if a call to NSC_EncryptUpdate was made with data smaller than the block size, a small out of bounds write could occur. This could have caused heap corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm2
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm2
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm2
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
